description: From Ancient Greek σημασία (sēmasía, “the meaning of a word”) + -λογία (-logía, “-logy, branch of study”), from σημαίνω (sēmaínō, “I show by a sign, signify”), from σῆμα (sêma, “a mark, sign”).

entries.meaning: (linguistics) Semantics; a discipline within linguistics concerned with the meaning of a word independent of its phonetic expression.
examples: "The early theories of semasiology attempted to account for meaning shifts in language."
